recommendations.recommendation: One of the best comedy anime ever a must see

anime.description: * Based on the Osomatsu-kun gag manga series by http://anidb.net/cr977 [Akatsuka Fujio]. The series features the six naughty and mischievous sextuplet sons of the Matsuno household with http://anidb.net/ch37177 [Osomatsu] as the oldest brother and the leader of the group. They were grade-schoolers back in the Shouwa period (1926–1989), but despite still living in the same old household, the street view as well as the lifestyle of modern-day society have changed drastically.

tag.name: dynamic
tag.description: Some of the central structural elements in anime are: Plot Continuity How does the plot or several plots unfold. Are they a strictly linear retelling of one big continuing story, a serial, possibly with several side stories, or is the content chopped into a set of unconnected episodes, only sharing the same setting and characters? Stereotype Characters Then there is the question of the character set presentation. Is it completely original, or is it your usual stereotypical character cast. Both choices have their merit, for example it would not really make much sense to reinvent the wheel for a harem anime. Fans of that genre come to expect their favourite stereotype protagonists. Plot Twists Finally there is the question of how complex the plot / the story unfolds. Are there side-plots that merge into the main plot leading to unexpected plot twists, or is the anime quite predictable? The latter would not be appropriate for detective stories. In harem anime on the other hand a foreseeable outcome is actually something the fans will come to expect.

tag.name: themes
tag.description: Themes describe the very central elements important to the anime stories. They set the backdrop against which the protagonists must face their challenges. Be it School Life, present Daily Life, Military action, Cyberpunk, Law and Order detective work, Sports, or the Underworld. These are only but a few of the more typical backgrounds for anime plots. Add to that a Conspiracy setting with a possible tragic outcome, the Themes span most of the imaginable subject matter relevant to anime.

tag.name: original work
tag.description: What the anime is based on! This is given as the original work credit in the OP. Mostly of academic interest, but a useful bit of info, hinting at the possible depth of story.

tag.name: setting
tag.description: The setting describes in what time and place an anime takes place. To a certain extent it describes what you can expect from the world in the anime.

tag.name: elements
tag.description: Next to Themes setting the backdrop for the protagonists in anime, there are the more detailed plot Elements that centre on character interactions: "What do characters do to each other or what is done to them?". Is it violent Action, an awe-inspiring Adventure in a foreign place, the gripping life of a Detective, a slapstick Comedy, an Ecchi Harem anime, a SciFi epic, or some Fantasy travelling adventure?

tag.name: place
tag.description: The places the anime can take place in. Includes more specific places such as a country on Earth, as well as more general places such as a dystopia or a mirror world.

tag.name: Earth
tag.description: The Earth is the third planet from the Sun, and the densest and fifth-largest of the eight planets in the Solar System. It is in effect a ball of hot mud, but on the surface it`s cold enough, so most of us live on it (or are supposed to). It is circa 4.5 billion years old, and, unless we humans succeed in destroying it over the next couple of centuries, it is expected to last for quite another while, though the changes in the Sun`s emissions due to its aging will likely cause the extinction of everything; the species of earthlings are guaranteed to die, even if we fail to kill them -- unless, of course, we find ourselves another planet and figure out a way to take everything there. Our little planet on a corner of this galaxy may mean nothing in the grand scheme of things, but to its inhabitants it is their home, so, as a species, we cherish it dearly, to the point many cultures even to this day deify it. Being the home to the human civilizations, the Earth is the main setting of most fiction, be it anime or otherwise, but not only are many titles set in other places, such as unrelated fantasy worlds, in a considerable number of fictional titles the Earth is actually destroyed by aggressive alien invaders.

tag.name: slapstick
tag.description: Slapstick humour is generally recognized by lots of physical abuse, horseplay and practical jokes. Also often seen are impossible situations, using sounds to illustrate impossible stunts that aren`t shown on-screen and to create tension for audience anticipation.

tag.name: parody
tag.description: Anime that imitate other stories (can be from TV, film, books, historical events, ...) for comic effect by exaggerating the style and changing the content of the original. Also known as spoofs. It can also refer to when whole elements of one work are lifted out of their context and reused.

tag.name: Japan
tag.description: Japan is a sovereign island nation in East Asia. Located in the Pacific Ocean, it lies off the eastern coast of the Asian mainland and stretches from the Sea of Okhotsk in the north to the East China Sea and China in the southwest. Source: Wikipedia

tag.name: manga
tag.description: Manga is the lifeblood that drives the anime industry. Everything and its mother is based on manga. However! There are exceptions where the manga was not the basis for the anime. It`s common practice to make manga adaptations of many popular anime, there`s a manga based on Evangelion, and two (one shounen and one shoujo) based on each of Escaflowne and Mahou Tsukai Tai. Also it`s quite common to release manga and anime versions of a story in parallel, for instance Nadesico and Shoujo Kakumei Utena. There are also cases where an anime continues in a manga, as in the case of Angel Beats! and Angel Beats: Heaven`s Door, or reverse. See also http://anidb.net/t6493 [manhua] and http://anidb.net/t5010 [manhwa].

tag.name: Asia
tag.description: Asia is Earth`s largest and most populous continent, located primarily in the eastern and northern hemispheres and sharing the continental landmass of Eurasia with the continent of Europe. Asia covers an area of 44,579,000 square kilometers, about 30% of Earth`s total land area and 8.7% of the Earth`s total surface area. The continent, which has long been home to the majority of the human population, was the site of many of the first civilizations. Asia is notable for not only its overall large size and population, but also dense and large settlements as well as vast barely populated regions within the continent of 4.4 billion people. Source: Wikipedia

tag.name: comedy
tag.description: Anime whose central struggle causes hilarious results. These stories are built upon funny characters, situations and events. A comedy anime is laced with humour and sets out to provoke laughter from the audience. Japanese humour can be a bit strange to westerners, so if you`re new to this type of humour, just bear with it; it`ll most likely grow on you if you`re a fan of other kinds of comedy.

tag.name: daily life
tag.description: The antics of the protagonists do not take place in some exotic setting or time, but in everyday life. When not "at the job" this means getting up in the morning, making meals, house cleaning, going shopping or out to eat, visiting the bath house or spa, leisure activities in the spare time, etc. The time "on the job" for students is School Life, for others working in their profession. Daily Life is basically a synonym for everything normal, repetitive, and trivial happening to your average person.

tag.name: unsorted
tag.description: a bunch of tags that still need to be either deleted or moved into proper places.

tag.name: wordplay
tag.description: The characters play with words. E.g. purposely or accidentally use similar-sounding but wrongly applied words in the Japanese original, leading to supposedly funny misunderstandings and confusion.

tag.name: working life
tag.description: The life of someone actually working on a often less than glamorous job is depicted in this anime. The job is taxing and the pay is low, not really the dream job one would choose to work in. Examples: Working as salesperson in a department store, or as a waitress in a family restaurant.

tag.name: gambling
tag.description: Gambling is the wagering of money or something of value (referred to as "the stakes") on an event with an uncertain outcome with the primary intent of winning additional money and/or material goods. Gambling thus requires three elements be present: consideration, chance and prize. The outcome of the wager is often immediate, such as a single roll of dice or a spin of a roulette wheel, but longer time frames are also common, allowing wagers on the outcome of a future sports contest or even an entire sports season. Source: Wikipedia

tag.name: ED variety
tag.description: Several ED sequences in this anime have either a different song or different animation, maybe even to the point of having a unique ED for each episode.

tag.name: cultural references
tag.description: The plot of this anime shows signs of cultural references, these are often jokes that make reference to a certain custom, habit or history that is specifically attributed to that culture. Knowledge of the culture itself is needed in order to properly understand these jokes.

tag.name: self-parody
tag.description: The anime is a parody of itself. I.e. the authors make fun of the genre they are portraying, and take the actions of their characters and story lightly.

tag.name: randomness
tag.description: The anime does not follow a predictable storyline. New, strange, obscure, or otherwise unexpected story elements are introduced at a whim.

tag.name: predominantly male cast
tag.description: The anime features a mostly male cast, i.e. female characters are rare. Example: Reverse harem setting with a plethora of bishounen.

tag.name: rivalry
tag.description: Quite broadly used term describing a conflict, contest, struggle, or opposition of some sort. Typical examples: The mostly comedic rivalry for the love of a protagonist in a harem anime (love polygon), the more "mindless" battles between wannabe delinquents in a school fighting anime, or the struggle between good & evil in an epic conflict for world domination.

tag.name: otaku culture
tag.description: Otaku (おたく/オタク) is a Japanese term used to refer to people with obsessive interests, particularly anime, manga, and video games. A female otaku is occasionally referred to as a fujoshi. (Source: Wikipedia) Here certain aspects of this "fandom" are presented in more detail, e.g. the creation of doujinshi (self-published amateur manga).

tag.name: technical aspects
tag.description: It may sometimes be useful to know about technical aspects of a show, such as information about its broadcasting or censorship. Such information can be found here.

tag.name: multi-segment episodes
tag.description: Multi-segment episodes are split into several short segments (parts), usually with separate titles and independent storylines. Not to be confused with http://anidb.net/t5852 [short episodes], which are regular episodes that are much shorter than the standard length (up to and including 10 minutes). Also not to be confused with an OVA or music video with multiple (otherwise unrelated) full-length http://anidb.net/t7241 [bundled episodes] consolidated into a single episode video track.

character.name: Iyayo
character.description: Female version of Iyami, after taking a Pretty Girl Drug.

character.name: Chibimi
character.description: Female version of Chibita, after taking a Pretty Girl Drug.

episode.title: 自立しよう / トト子なのだ
Let`s Become Independent / This Is Totoko
Jiritsu Shiyou / Totoko na no Da
episode.summary: Osomatsu and his brothers don`t try any harder to get jobs and continue to live with their parents. However, their parents suddenly say they`re getting a divorce and are going to sell the house. Then Osomatsu is invited to his beloved Totoko-chan`s room. He knows he probably shouldn`t get his hopes up, but he definitly didn`t expect what followed... Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: こぼれ話集
Tidbits Collection
Koborebanashi Shuu
episode.summary: This week`s episode is the tidbits collection. Everything from Dekapan-man, to what happens if you try to horde your pachinko winnings, to a bath house quiz. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 就職しよう / おそ松の憂鬱
Let`s Get a Job / The Melancholy of Osomatsu
Shuushoku Shiyou / Osomatsu no Yuuutsu
episode.summary: The sextuplets attempt to find a job, and Osomatsu tries to find where all of his brothers went off to. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 復活! おそ松くん
Osomatsu-kun Returns
Fukkatsu! Osomatsu-kun
Ending
Opening
なごみのおそ松 / トト子の夢
The Calming Osomatsu / Totoko`s Dream
Nagomi no Osomatsu / Totoko no Yume
episode.summary: The Calming Detective Osomatsu shows up to try to solve a murder mystery, Totoko reveals her true dreams, and Karamatsu and Jyushimatsu sing a song from the heart. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: トド松と5人の悪魔 / 4個 / 北へ
Todomatsu and the Five Demons / Four / Going North
Todomatsu to 5 Nin no Akuma / 4 Ko / Kita e
episode.summary: The brothers find out that Todomatsu is actually working at Sutabaa Coffee, the six try to figure out how to split four into six, and Dayon and Dekapan head north. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: おたんじょうび会ダジョー / イヤミの大発見
It`s a Birthday Party, Dajo / Iyami`s Great Discovery
Otanjoubikai Dajou / Iyami no Daihakken
episode.summary: The sextuplets recieve a birthday party invitation from their childhood friend, Hatabou. They wonder how he`s been lately since they hadn`t seen him in years and receive a shock when they go to his current residence. Everyone`s idol Iyami has lost his job and can`t seem to catch a break with gambling ever since he came back from France (at least, he says he`s from France). To make things worse, he ends up chipping his treasured overbite... However this leads to some unlikely consequences. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: カラ松事変 / エスパーニャンコ
The Karamatsu Incident / ESP Kitty
Karamatsu Jihen / Esper Nyanko
episode.summary: Chibita`s had enough of the sextuplets ripping him off and kidnaps Karamatsu, demanding a ransom for his return... And Jyushimatsu takes Ichimatsu to Professor Dekapan to try to see if they can get a cat to talk so Ichimatsu can have a friend. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: イヤミチビ太のレンタル彼女
Iyami and Chibita`s Rental Girlfriend
Iyami Chibita no Rental Kanojo
episode.summary: Iyami decides to start a rental girlfriend company with his old partner in crime, Chibita, and their targets are none other than the sextuplets. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: チビ太とおでん / 恋する十四松
Chibita and Oden / Juushimatsu Falls in Love
Chibita to Oden / Koi Suru Juushimatsu
episode.summary: Chibita helps Karamatsu achieve his dreams, whether he wants his help or not, and Jyushimatsu finds love. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 年末スペシャルさん
Year-End Special-san
Nenmatsu Special-san
episode.summary: It`s the year-end special, and Osomatsu and Totoko look back at the episodes to decide the biggest Losermatsu. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ブラックサンタ / 逆ナン / The Perfect Christmas / プレゼント交換 / クリスマス飲み / 土下座
Black Santa / Picked Up by a Girl / The Perfect Christmas / Exchanging Presents / Christmas Drinking / Groveling
Black Santa / Kyaku Nan / The Perfect Christmas / Present Koukan / Christmas Nomi / Dogeza
episode.summary: Merry Christmas from Matsuno family and friends! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 松野松楠 / 一松事変
Matsuno Matsunan / The Ichimatsu Incident
Matsuno Matsunan / Ichimatsu Jihen
episode.summary: The Matsus face the end of the century, and Ichimatsu faces a serious dilemma involving Karamatsu. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 面接 / チビ太の花の命
Interview / The Life of Chibita`s Flower
Mensetsu / Chibita no Hana no Inochi
episode.summary: Jyushimatsu goes in for a job interview, the Girlymatsus go on a trip, and Chibita finds out there`s more to life than oden. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 風邪ひいた / トド松のライン / チョロ松先生
We Caught a Cold / Todomatsu`s Line / Choromatsu-sensei
Kaze Hiita / Todomatsu no Line / Choromatsu-sensei
episode.summary: The sextuplets catch a cold and the brothers confront Todomatsu about never telling them anything. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 実松さん / じょし松さん / 事故?
Sanematsu-san / Girlymatsu-san / Accident?
Sanematsu-san / Joshimatsu-san / Jiko?
episode.summary: Osomatsu catches Choromatsu doing something he never ever wanted anyone to see. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: Episode T2
Episode T1
教えてハタ坊 / スクール松 / イヤミの学校
Tell Us, Hatabou / School Matsu / Iyami`s School
Oshiete Hatabou / School Matsu / Iyami no Gakkou
episode.summary: Everyone wants to know what kind of meat Hatabou is cooking, who`s the leader of the school, and Iyami teaches the sextuplets a thing or two about comedy. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: しどう 聖澤庄之助さん / 時代劇おそ松さん / じょし松さん / チョロ松ライジング
Starting! Hijirisawa Shonosuke-san / Period Drama Osomatsu-san / Girlymatsu-san / Choromatsu Rising
Shidou Hijirisawa Shounosuke-san / Jidaigeki Osomatsu-san / Joshimatsu-san / Choromatsu Rising
episode.summary: Starting this week, this show will now be known as "Hijirikawa Shounosuke-san." Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: じょし松さん / 逆襲のイヤミ
Girlymatsu-san / Iyami`s Counterattack
Joshimatsu-san / Gyakushuu no Iyami
episode.summary: Iyami is out to get revenge after the sextuplets stole his spotlight. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 十四松まつり
Jyushimatsu Festival
Juushimatsu Matsuri
episode.summary: It`s a Jyushimatsu Festival! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: トト子大あわて / 手紙
Totoko`s Huge Panic / Letter
Totoko Ooawate / Tegami
episode.summary: Totoko tries to find herself an oil magnate and Choromatsu finally gets a job. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 灯油 / ダヨーン族
Kerosene / Dayon Tribe
Touyu / Dayoun Zuko
episode.summary: The brothers fight over who`s going to change the kerosene in the heater, and they meet the Dayon Tribe. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 希望の星, トド松 / ファイナルシェー
The Star of Hope, Todomatsu / Final Sheeeh
Kibou no Hoshi, Todomatsu / Final Shee
episode.summary: Todomatsu is the sextuplets` only hope in losing their virginity, and Iyami might just be the master of an ancient martial art. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 麻雀 / 神松
Mahjong / Godmatsu
Mahjong / Kamimatsu
episode.summary: The sextuplets play mahjong, and then meet their new holier brother. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 松汁 / 童貞なヒーロー
Matsujiru / Virgin Heroes
Matsu Shiru / Doutei na Hero
episode.summary: F6 shares their beauty secret and Choromatsu has a run in with the Virgin Vigilante Corps, Cherry Brothers. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ショートフィルムシリーズ#02「OSOMATSU BLASTER」
Short Film Series #02: Osomatsu Blaster
Short Film Series #02: Osomatsu Blaster
6つ子だよ, 全員集合!! トト子もいるよ♪
Sextuplets, All Assemble!! Totoko Is Here, Too
Mutsugo Da yo, Zen`in Shuugou!! Totoko mo Iru yo
ショートフィルムシリーズ#01「しりとり」

Short Film Series #01: Shiritori
おそまつさんでした
Osomatsu-san, Such As It Was
Osomatsu-san Deshita
episode.summary: It all goes out with a bang. Source: crunchyroll

Short Film Series #03: Kara & Todo Rhythm
Short Film Series #03: Kara & Todo Rhythm
